title: Operations Officer Job at Greystone Consulting Limited
content:
Greystone Consulting Limited - Our client is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Operations Officer

Job Location: Gbagada, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Our client is looking for an Operations Officer who would be responsible for ensuring the smooth and efficient daily operations of the business, optimizing workflow, managing inventory, and supporting financial and customer service processes.
	This role plays a key part in maintaining quality standards, streamlining production and enhancing overall business performance.


Duties/ Responsibilities
Operations & Process Management:


	Oversee daily baking, decorating, and dessert catering workflows to ensure efficiency.
	Implement Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for production, inventory, and logistics.
	Identify and resolve bottlenecks in production and order fulfilment.
	Ensure adherence to health, safety and food-handling regulations.


Inventory & Supply Chain Management:


	Management of stock levels of baking ingredients, packaging materials and supplies
	Coordinates with vendors and suppliers to ensure timely restocking and cost control
	Track and minimise ingredient waste and spoilage.


Customer Order & Delivery Coordination:


	Ensure smooth handling of customer orders from processing to fulfilment.
	Coordinate timely deliveries for event catering, custom cakes and daily orders
	Work with customer service to resolve customer complaints and ensure a great customer experience.
	Any unresolved complaints should be directed to the Managing Director.


Financial & Budgeting Support:


	Monitor operational expenses and cost control strategies.
	Track and report financial performance related to supplies, production and deliveries
	Work with the finance team to ensure accurate pricing, invoicing and cost analysis


Team Management & Performance Monitoring:


	Oversee bakers, decorators and the order management process to ensure productivity and adherence to deadlines.
	Maintain and analyze end-of-day reports from the baking and decorating teams.
	Support in hiring, training, and performance management of team members.


Quality Control & Compliance:


	Ensure all cakes, desserts, and treats meet Dara's BAKES n Cakes' quality standards
	Implement corrective actions to maintain consistency and customer satisfaction.


Technology & Tool Management:


	Utilize Zoho CRM, Zoho Books, Zoho Inventory and Zoho Sales IQ for operational efficiency.
	Maintain accurate records of sales, inventory and expenses using digital tools.


Experience / Qualifications


	Candidate must possess a minimum of a Bachelor's Degree / HND in Business Operations Management, Food Science, related courses, and Previous experience in a similar role, preferably in the food industry. Must have strong customer service and team management skills.


Key Skill Sets:


	Organisation & Management skills
	Professional in relating to people
	Communication and interpersonal skills
	Process improvement and Optimization
	Analytical & problem-solving skills
	Good time management & optimisation
	Adaptability & Crisis Management
	Financial & Budgeting skills.


Work Tools:


	Computer applications, i.e Excel, Word, PowerPoint
	Customer Relationship Management (CRM), Inventory application, Time Management Applications,
	Project & Task Management Tools.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates can send their CVs to: Consultgreystone@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Media Manager Job at Prixair Group
content:
Prixair Group is a dynamic and diversified company committed to excellence across various industries including hospitality, beauty, events, logistics, media, and lifestyle services. With a passion for delivering world-class experiences, Prixair has built a strong reputation for quality, professionalism, and innovation.

Driven by a customer-first philosophy, Prixair Group continuously sets industry benchmarks through exceptional service delivery, operational efficiency, and a dedicated workforce. Our diverse portfolio of brands works seamlessly together to provide top-tier solutions that meet the evolving needs of individuals and organizations.
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Media Manager
Job Location: Gaduwa, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports To: COO
Department: Media & Communications / Production

Job Summary


	The Media Manager is responsible for planning, coordinating, and overseeing all media operations, including equipment handling, sound, lighting, videography, content production, post-production, and media advertising.
	This role ensures the delivery of high-quality media content across various platforms while managing the media team and resources effectively.


Key Responsibilities
Media Production & Management:


	Supervise all aspects of media production — from pre-production to post-production.
	Manage audio-visual equipment, lighting, sound systems, and cameras.
	Oversee live recordings, studio shoots, and outdoor video productions.
	Coordinate the scheduling of shoots, content creation, and production timelines.
	Ensure smooth post-production processes including editing, color grading, and sound mixing.


Team Leadership:


	Lead and coordinate a team of videographers, sound engineers, editors, and creatives.
	Provide direction during shoots and ensure content meets quality and brand standards.
	Train and support junior media team members.


Technical Operations:


	Maintain and troubleshoot all media equipment (cameras, lights, mics, mixers, etc.).
	Ensure backup systems are in place for sound, lighting, and recordings.
	Manage media file storage, backup, and content delivery systems.


Marketing & Advertising:


	Collaborate with marketing and advertising teams to create visual content for campaigns.
	Oversee production of promotional videos, social media content, adverts, and branded visuals.
	Ensure media aligns with the overall communication and branding strategy.


Content Oversight:


	Manage content calendars and media release schedules.
	Review and approve final outputs before publishing or airing.


Budgeting & Resource Management:


	Prepare media production budgets and track expenses.
	Source and manage vendors, freelancers, and third-party production crews when needed.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s degree in Media Production, Mass Communication, Film, or related field.
	8-12 years of experience in media production, broadcasting, or creative direction.
	Proficient with media tools: Adobe Premiere Pro, After Effects, Final Cut Pro, DaVinci Resolve, etc.
	Strong knowledge of sound design, lighting setup, camera operations, and post-production.
	Experience with both studio and field production environments.
	Excellent organizational and leadership skills.
	Creativity, attention to detail, and the ability to meet tight deadlines.


Preferred Skills:


	Drone operation
	Social media content strategy
	Motion graphics or animation basics
	Photography knowledge
	Livestreaming experience.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CVs to: amandaosifoedwards@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Digital Executive Job at Ascentech Services Limited
content:
Ascentech Services Limited is a full-fledged Human Resource Solution Provider incorporated in 2013 with its Head Office in Lagos, Nigeria. We are committed to forging long-term partnerships with our clients by creating and delivering robust and flexible services that address the changing needs of their business.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Digital Executive

Job Location: Surulere, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We’re looking for a savvy, strategic, and hands-on Digital Executive who will be responsible for elevating our digital presence and driving strong online performance across social platforms.
	The ideal candidate is deeply passionate about digital trends, data-driven strategies, and crafting engaging consumer experiences that convert. Experience working across multiple African markets is a strong advantage.


Key Responsibilities


	Lead and execute the brand’s digital strategy across all channels (social media, website, email marketing).
	Drive performance marketing campaigns to drive online engagement and grow online presence.
	Manage the planning, scheduling, and analysis of all social media platforms, including community management.
	Collaborate with internal teams (creative, brand, trade) and external partners (agencies, influencers, e-commerce platforms).
	Monitor digital trends, performance analytics, and consumer insights to inform strategy and refine execution.
	Ensure brand consistency and tone of voice across all online touchpoints.


Requirements


	3+ years of proven experience in digital and content marketing.
	Strong grasp of digital platform (Meta, TikTok, YouTube, WhatsApp, Pinterest etc.).
	Experience growing and managing brand presence online across multiple countries.
	Exceptional communication, storytelling, and copywriting skills.
	Ability to work cross-functionally and juggle multiple digital campaigns at once.


Good to have:


	Experience managing digital campaigns or platforms across African markets (e.g., Ghana, Kenya, South Africa).
	Prior experience with regional adaptation of content and digital strategy for culturally diverse African audiences.
	A deep understanding of the beauty and lifestyle consumer space in Africa.
	Previously working in a digital agency.


What We Offer


	A vibrant, creative work environment where innovation is encouraged.
	The chance to shape the digital future of a brand loved across the continent.
	Growth opportunities across a fast-expanding international team.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates can send their CV to: cv@ascentech.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
